intro: Tripterospermum hualienense, commonly known as the Hualien mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
